page.title: 17Ditchling Morris Dancers
page.content: The tradition of Morris dancing has recently been revived in Ditchling and an enthusiastic group meets for practice in the Playing Fields Pavilion at weekends. With the "Squire"John Bacon on the accordion,Vanessa playing the recorder and Lorna the oboe,men,women and children are learning the old dances Balance the Straw, Bonny Green Garters, Saturday Night and Constant Billy. The Morris Group wear patriotic red, white and blue costume, flower strewn hats and bells on their garters and laces. Their emblem, designed by the local sculptor's son Jonathan Skelton, shows a torch to represent Ditchling Beacon.
